name: 資訊與通訊技術
description:
Information and telecommunication are two major industries which have already dominated significant revenue share of Taiwan’s high technology industries. For non-technical background management of technology (MOT) major students, an understanding of the information and telecommunication technology is an essential for successful future researches and MOT related career developments. Thus, this course intends to provide MOT students a preliminary introduction of information and telecommunication technology.
Part One: Computer Hardware
goals: 探討資訊與通訊技術基本知識理論與應用。
了解科技產業之資訊與通訊技術之重要性。
培養具備多元思考的能力與積極健全之職場倫理。
syllabus:
Information and telecommunication are two major industries which have already dominated significant revenue share of Taiwan’s high technology industries. For non-technical background management of technology (MOT) major students, an understanding of the information and telecommunication technology is an essential for successful future researches and MOT related career developments. Thus, this course intends to provide MOT students a preliminary introduction of information and telecommunication technology.  
Part One: Computer Hardware  
1\. The core of computing  
2\. Memory, storage, and input/output  
3\. Computer monitors and graphics systems  
4\. Silicon economics  
Part Two: Software  
5\. Fundamentals of the operating system  
6\. Evolution of the operating system (OS)  
7\. Microcomputer OS  
8\. Programming, object oriented technology, and software development  
Part Three: Telecommunication Fundamentals and Voice over IP  
9\. Basic concepts of telecommunications  
10\. VoIP Systems, circuit switched PBXs and Cabling  
Part Four: Industry Overview and Public Networks  
11\. Telecommunication industry overview  
12\. VoIP, the Public Switched Telephone Network, and Signaling  
13\. VPN and Specialized Network Services  
Part Five: Advanced Technologies, Cable TV Networks, and the Internet  
14\. Entertainment, cable TV, and last-mile fiber systems  
15\. The internet  
Part Six: Wireless Services  
16\. Mobile services  
17\. Wi-Fi, wireless broadband, sensor networks, and personal area networks
